title.narrative: 4.2. Decision makers have access to knowledge, analysis and monitoring tools to develop evidence-based policies for NCD prevention in children and adolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF has consolidated its role as a key player in obesity prevention issues through its engagement with actors at multiple levels. Throughout this process, it has been found that decision makers are often gladly receptive to UNICEF's child-rights-based approach and evidence-based policy advice and are therefore highly responsive to it. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of advocacy mechanisms, studies and investigations published that support the existence of a national policy of obesity prevention.
Technical proposal developed to incorporate obesity-measuring model into official data regarding nutritional state of children and adolescents.
